description.narrative: IFC, Natixis and other commercial lenders are jointly establishing a trade finance facility of up to US$ 450 million to finance year 2014 importation of refined oil products in Ethiopia. The facility will provide Independent Petroleum Group Limited (IPG) with a short term structured trade finance facility to maintain the supply of oil products to Ethiopia over one year. This facility will help securing fuel supply to the second most populated country in Sub-Saharan Africa and one of the fastest growing economies in Africa. A steady supply of fuel through reliable channels is critical to ensure a better pricing, and therefore control inflation. Of the total facility amount, IFCs funded and unfunded exposure will be up to US$ 150 million in a form of direct parallel lending. IFC has financed the year 2013 importation of refined oil products in Ethiopia through a risk participation facility with BNP Paribas (IFC project number 32846)

The proposed investment will have significant development impacts as follows: (a) Maintain the availability of trade finance in Ethiopia. The Project is expected to finance about US$ 1 billion of imports of oil products to Ethiopia over a year. This will ensure stability in supply of energy products into an IDA economy. (b) Ensuring availability of energy products is critical for retail and industrial consumption, power and transportation sectors. (c) Support to Private Sector - The facility will indirectly support the business activities of private marketing and distribution companies in the downstream oil sector.
